DOC.brief_summary: Yearly , 15,000 Dutch vitro fertilization ( IVF ) cycle perform subfertility pregnancy rate 26 % . A failed cycle great emotional impact ; 20-25 % woman relevant form depression/anxiety even 6 month . For maladjustment risk profile identify translated screen tool . Identification woman risk enable timely tailor ( individual 's need ) cognitive behavioral therapy ( CBT ) , reduce serious maladjustment corresponding cost . Aim : To investigate effectiveness e-health CBT ( digital coaching , Digicoach ) woman ongoing IVF screen risk . Design : A single-centered randomise control trial compare Digicoach ( intervention ) standard care ( control ) . Digicoach : e-health CBT 4-12 weekly session start IVF cycle , follow woman 's IVF course cover module main problem : depress mood , anxiety , strong focus child wish acceptance . Main outcome measure : anxiety depression occurrence rate 3 week unsuccessful IVF cycle . Secondary outcome measure : 1 . ( para ) medical consumption , 2. quality life , 3. productivity loss 4 . IVF outcome . Data collect questionnaire , diary , medical record audit page view registration . Process evaluation : Individual 's use ( e.g . module progress , completion rate ) , experience , ( e.g . satisfaction usability ) potential barrier implementation evaluate . Economic evaluation : study Digicoach exposures societal perspective . Incremental cost ( costs/ % avoidance depression/anxiety ) determine compare study group . Power/data analysis : To detect 29 % difference depression/anxiety occurrence rate ( alfa=0.05 beta=0.80 ) 58 unpregnant IVF woman evaluate .
DOC.brief_title: E-health Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Women Treated Vitro Fertilization ( IVF )
DOC.criteria: woman screen 'at risk ' emotional maladjustment In vitro fertilization ( IVF ) screen tool impossibility use Internet impossibility write read Dutch language high screening score require immediate intervention
